creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Long strip of yellow satin brocaded with nine five-clawed dragons in profile in gold with accents of red and blue. In the surrounding fields appear the Heavenly Jewel and loosely-drawn clouds in shades of blue, green, red, and tan. With the exception of the brocaded areas, the ground is completely filled in with laid embroidery in pale peach-colored silk floss. The brocaded areas worn badly in spots. Lining of coarse gold-colored cotton. From the Emperor's palace?
title: Long strip of yellow satin
